summary: I. Charles Mathews, also known as Isiah C. Mathews, was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) from October 1977 to November 1978. Payroll records and authorization forms document his employment, including details about his position, salary, and gross pay during that period. These documents focus on the administrative aspects of his employment with the HSCA.
significance: Medium. I. Charles Mathews' significance is moderate. While he is mentioned in a substantial number of documents (45), the documents primarily relate to his payroll and employment details within the HSCA, suggesting an administrative or support role rather than a direct involvement in the core investigation.
